alert.note: Alert for McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 8:01AM MDT until August 19 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL MCKINLEY COUNTY... At 801 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gallup, Manuelito, Rock Springs, Yah-Ta-Hey, Tse Bonito, Mentmore, Allison, Gamerco and Red Rock State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 1 and 24, Low Mesa Road, Hunters Point Road, State Roads 118, 264, and 602, Reservation Roads 7043 and 7046, and County Roads 1 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
